intro: ᖱᗩ ᕈᙓᙓᑕᙓ make Love not War. Protect the Internet, the largest project of mankind on Earth. Don't ask for your privacy. Take it back.

post.body: da peece! ;) ZeroMe!
Started developing a ZeroChat-Zite, with the help of this guide https://decentralize.today/decentralized-p2p-chat-in-100-lines-of-code-d6e496034cd4#.anjk2dtly

Title for my ZeroChat-based Zite:
Da_Net

For style, it uses a work-in-progress-modified fork of Spectre.css (https://picturepan2.github.io/spectre/) and some icons from ZeroMe.
Furthermore it makes use of jQuery (https://jquery.com/), Moment.js (http://momentjs.com/) and Identicon.js (http://github.com/stewartlord/identicon.js) (which requires PNGLib (http://www.xarg.org/download/pnglib.js)).

The picture shows the view of the chat..

Some visual improvements to Da_Net! :)
The idea with Message-Balloons came from plasmmer@zeroid.bit

~~(I'm actually not quite sure how to let the balloon expand to the right/left, if more text is in it >:|)~~

Next missions:
 - Citation of messages (kinda like an answer/reply)
 - Picture (and maybe video and audio) implementation (?also with comment?)  [will require me, to look futher into 'optional files']
 - Private messages (kinda like ZeroMail) [will probably be *very* hard for me, like really! :/)
 - Markdown-Support [isn't hard, but I'll have to replace the current input with a textarea, which may require additional tweaking]
 - ~~EMOJI's xD (every chat needs'em)~~

Maybe some kind of "beta"-program, so that some people can test it :?

Any other ideas, recommendations or tips/tricks?
.. Tell me :)

- EMOJI's now available on Da_Net 🎉!
You can insert them via GitHub-like style ":smile:" and via System-Emoji's (e.g. in Android on a Keyboard with Emoji-Support 😮)!
The Emoji are provided by https://emojione.com/.
 - Added a "Ideas/Changelog"-Sub-Tab in "About"
 - ..I also managed it to fit the width of the Message-Balloons according to their content.. xD

I think the next mission is adding Markdown-support (won't be hard,.... I hope x_O) :)

# I'm workin on Markdown-Support for Da_Net right now!

I'm using [Marked](https://github.com/chjj/marked) to achive it!

Or well, it is finished... but I have to modify the message-input a little bit >:/

Can anyone tell me, what I'm doing wrong, when I get the following error:
`Internal error: KeyError: u'data/users/14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy/content.json'
UiWebsocket.py line 105 > UiWebsocket.py line 210 > MergerSitePlugin.py line 185 > MergerSitePlugin.py line 182 > UiWebsocket.py line 344 > ContentManager.py line 498 > ContentDbDict.py line 55 > ContentDbDict.py line 28`

Because it seems that no new data/users/USER/content.json-File is created, which seems to cause some trouble (the part with siteSign-cmd is missing [here](https://decentralize.today/decentralized-p2p-chat-in-100-lines-of-code-d6e496034cd4) but not [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:99:ZeroChat+tutorial), and also on the medium-post, the sitePublish-Cmd publishes the users data.json!), as the database won't populate either.. :/

So could anyone give me a clue, on how to fix this pls :?

So I finally managed to fix everything in Da_Net, somewhat thanks to @nofish :)

Now onto the fun things again :D

(I removed the "Parse Links"-Option, as there isn't much reason left, to have it available..)

Lol, @bmoon just wrote the first message on Da_Net, and I recognized that the times are actually off-set xD

But I hope, I fixed it :D

## Da_Net
 - ~~Added Timestamp-Links (or actually 'unique' message-id-links) [Example](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CWkZv7fQAKxTVjZVrLZ8VHcrN6YGGcdky/#tc_299)~~ **(This does not really work at the moment (April 10th, 2017))**
 - Added 'Scrolltobottom'-Button, ... to scroll to the bottom/ the newest message

## Can anyone "teach"/explain to me on how to use the OptionalManager-Plugin/ optional files in general :?
(preferably with Javascript, and not CoffeeScript) (at least I think, that's what I need, to serve optional files like ZeroMe does for images).

Because I just don't understand, what I have to configure, and how >:|

Like, if/ when should I define the "optional"-Property in the Zites `content.json`, and if/ when should I define the "permission_rules"-"files_allowed_optional"-Property in `data/users/content.json`.....

I checked the [API-Reference](http://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/zeroframe_api_reference/#plugin-optionalmanager), [this](http://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/content_json/#user_contents), [this](http://zeronet.readthedocs.io/en/latest/site_development/dbschema_json/), and the source-code of some Zites.. And I have to say, *I DON'T GET IT*

So technically, there now is Image-support on Da_Net, BUT it's most certain, not correct!

(You have to place the image into your `data/users`-Directory, and then you can include it via `![ALT-TEXT](/1CWkZv7fQAKxTVjZVrLZ8VHcrN6YGGcdky/data/users/USERCERT/FILENAME)`, e.g. `![Cute little baby kitty cat](/1CWkZv7fQAKxTVjZVrLZ8VHcrN6YGGcdky/data/users/14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy/1.jpg)`.

I don't even know if it works, as [I just don't understand the docs/ other Zites source codes regarding the Optional-Files-Function](/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy/1491664544)..

This obviously, will get automated through just clickin a button, selecting the image, and then hitting send, but till that, someone really has to give me some more information on the Optional-Files-topic!

PS.: I'm now having trouble, signing my own `data.json`-File as it seems, though I've no clue why :/ (I have to "Overwrite the File" (or whatever, already forgot the text xP))

([Link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy/1491664544))

I've managed it to add a Image-Upload-function to **Da_Net** with help of some of [ZeroMusic](/1MusicXkuN2pk5hRdmroeyaCLDJtzTicpB)'s SourceCode!

Though I believe it didn't fix the optional-files-problem I've got,.. >:| so I really need help with it!

([Link 1](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy/1491687319), [Link 2](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1oranGeS2xsKZ4jVsu9SVttzgkYXu4k9v/14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy/1491664544))

@nofish: maybe :?

The uploading and signing of the optional files/ media-files (currently only `png, jpg, jpeg, gif`) on
# ThunderWave
(formerly **Da_Net**)
should now work correct!

Creating a GitHub-Repository for **ThunderWave** right now!
Will take some time, as *EmojiOne* has a huge amount of `.png`-Files for all the Emoji's x_x

(All in all, I'll have to push 1960 files :O)
# [ThunderWave](/1CWkZv7fQAKxTVjZVrLZ8VHcrN6YGGcdky/) is now on [GitHub](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave)

# ThunderWave
## Major Update!
The first major update has arrived for [ThunderWave](/1CWkZv7fQAKxTVjZVrLZ8VHcrN6YGGcdky), adding the [feature](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/10) to download/ delete optional (meaning "sent by other users") Media-files, and display additional information about them!

Also, some visual improvements were made, like e.g. a option to select the [design of the speech balloons](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/4), [Link2](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/11).

# ThunderWave
## Update
### Added basic `mp3`, and `ogg` uploading!
Uploading of `mp3` or `ogg`-Media-Files will result in a link being
pasted into the message-input, linking to the file!

So currently, there won't be any "automated" way, of either listening/
viewing the file, nor of letting it be removed by some easy click,
though (at least that's what I hope) both of these features will get
added sooner or later.

Link to [GitHub-Commit](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/commit/50d6010b79df07176deb376fa0ee4b63b9b37053)

# Visit ThunderWave now at [thunderwave.bit](/thunderwave.bit)!
## ThunderWave has got a domain-name!
### Many thanks to @Plasmmer for providing the domain! :)

Apparently I chatted with myself on ThunderWave,.. for I believe, quite some time, because as it seems [my `data.json`](http://127.0.0.1:43110/thunderwave.bit/data/users/14K7EydgyeP84L1NKaAHBZTPQCev8BbqCy/data.json) on [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit) isn't seeding to other users :|

## I've got 3 questions..
#### (at the moment)
1. Is there any documentation about Hubs?
As far as I understand them, they are just normal Zites... though they actually have a undocumented property in use for their own `content.json`-File (`merged_type`, yes, this is documented, but really poor!), and for the other Zite's it's being used by, `content.json`-File (`settings > default_hubs`) :?
2. Also, I just wanted to point out that/ ask why in the docs there seems to be no mention of `auth_address`, `directory`, or `directories` being optional parameters, as seen [here](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/blob/master/js/ZeroMe.coffee#L248) and [here](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroMe/blob/6982bab71814bca49aea7437da7b1a27700d5544/js/ActivityList.coffee#L60).?
3. How exactly do I achieve the effect of merging multiple Hubs to one DB, like ZeroMe seems to do?

Also, [here's a link](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/23) to an Issue on ThunderWave's GitHub-Repo, regarding the ability to access users avatars from ZeroMe.
Is there any way for a user to directly connect to a specific other user on a Zite, knowing only that users public key?

## ThunderWave
### I've got the private chat working,..
#### basically..

The only problem I'm encountering right now, is that the sender can't read his own messages, as they are encrypted with the public key of the recipient, who is the only one who can read the messages sent to him, as he is the only one, who has his own private key.

So I could save all the messages sent, into another file, which doesn't get seeded, as I already described in the first comment I wrote in [this Issue on GitHub](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/6), **but**, anybody who has the private key of the sender, would then be able to read *ALL* the messages he sent, and received.
And that is not really good I think, is it!? 👎



### Question:
> So, is there any way I can decrypt the messages, that the sender sent, while being the sender?

### Private messages in [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
 In theory, one now can send private messages through ThunderWave!
But as I still have to fix some serious issues, there currently is neither a input, nor a correct-working "Private Chats"-Tab.

For further information please visit [Issue #6 on GitHub-Repo](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/6).

## [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
### Update
#### Added Private chat!
Yes, they do basically work,..
No, it's not really good,... yet.

You can now check the "Last seen"-Tab for available users, that already have the latest version of ThunderWave, and thus, have a `public key`-Entry.
Click the users public key, and the private chat will be opened.

Also, the other user will currently not receive any notification that a new message has arrived.
This results in the fact, that you actually have to click the tab at the top again (that with the users cert_id), to reload the chat.

*Beware, as this is still in active development, and has many bugs!*
*Also, all your private messages may be deleted due to change of encryption!*

For further information please visit [Issue #6 on GitHub-Repo](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/6).

## ThunderWave
### Update
#### Avatars!! :)

See GitHub-Issues [#23](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/23) and [#47](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/47) for some information about Avatars on ThunderWave.

PS.: You can now add a external source for your avatar, e.g. your ZeroMe-Avatar, or put a Avatar into your user-directory of this Zite (1CWkZv7fQAKxTVjZVrLZ8VHcrN6YGGcdky)

For further information on how to use them, visit [this link](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/47#issuecomment-294473097)

## [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
### Update
#### New Avatar-System!!
**I finally managed to update the Avatar-System to use Avatars from ZeroMe!**

So, if you have an account on ZeroMe, and use the same ID to chat on ThunderWave, _and_ have set the `avatar_type`-Property to `2` (which means, that you want that other users load your avatar from ZeroMe), then other users (and of course, you too) will be able to see the avatar, you uploaded to your ZeroMe-account!

For further information about this, check [this GitHub-Issue-Comment](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/23#issuecomment-317186086).
[What do you think?](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/36)

Sooooo, I'm not really good in debugging this screen...... **but** I _do know_, that _**5500ms**_ (that's 5.5 seconds) loading time is definitely **NOT** good.

So all in all, I think I really have to re-write the complete code for ThunderWave, to fix _anything_.
And I should probably think about implementing an Web- or Service-Worker (or both) as well, to speed things up even more, and load more things asynchronously.

So, I just got an email from `aiden@srskteam.org` (PS.: I checked the link, and it seems like they just want your Bitcoins and Ethereums (or whatever)..: TITLE: `Invitation #35266 for the top members of the Zeronet community.` (just a question, did anybody else receive a similar mail :?) First this is a real person from a real account--this isn't spam. Yes, we found you in a programmatic fashion but I think when you hear who else also got this strange email and what we are looking to do you may be surprised (at least you won't waste your time reading this email). 9 months ago we started with a simple premise, “what if we could rebuild the fervor of the original Bitcoin community?”. This lead to the creation of “Multivac” an algorithm that monitors chat rooms, github repos/commits, and forums of cryptocurrencies. As the community exploded in size, Multivac’s known universe grew to 33 currencies, 36.8 million messages/commits, and at the time of this writing 971,066 people. Inline with the original premise we filtered out: - All new users with relatively low experience in the respective crypto currency. - People with only a few small chats or who had spent little time logged in to the forums or channels. - Users with low github interactions & events. These filters removed 94.5% of the list. The resulting 63,305 people who remained--of which due to your involvement in you are one--is arguably one of the most densely populated group of crypto currency enthusiasts assembled to date. As you can imagine if we do nothing the potential of this community will fade into the ether (pun intended), and so let us explain why we engaged you: We know the reason for volatile crypto prices, ridiculous ICO valuations, and over all hype is because of the speculative condition of its user base. If we, as this strong community came together to make distributed apps, smart contracts, and wallets simple to work we will create undeniable value, protect future investors/innovation, and potentially lead by example in this new world financial system. Knowledge is power, let's give it away. 1. Now that is has come time for our ICO we will circumvent the hype entirely by holding a private sale through invitation codes to only the members of this list. In cryptography and Multivac we trust. This is why there is a unique invite code at the bottom of this email required to participate. 2. Build an enterprise grade multi blockchain messaging system that makes it simple--even a pleasure--to work with and use smart contracts, right from inside your chat---bringing the outside world in. 3. Unlike Status.im--who only works on Ethereum--we built on Bitcoin and made the messaging platform work on all major smart contract blockchain. This experienced community is small, all developers innovating in it should be able to freely execute any dapp on any blockchain. Your invite code, re-useable, but truly unique. [CODE, if this really is no scam (which is very unlikely) xD] Continue on to the website https://statusrsk.org PS: To retain the integrity of this community, we ask that this email remains private for you alone. If you don’t continue on to the site don’t worry you will never hear from us again. Thank you for your involvement in this space. We need more of it. PSS: If you think this was our last stunt, this is just the beginning. We may not have been the first crypto currency, but we will be the last.

## [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
### Update
#### Added Feed-Notifications-option
**The new option `Notifications in ZeroHello-Feed` enables you to see messages from the Lobby, _in_ your ZeroHello-Feed!**

For this option to show up, you have to update the options, which you can do by either "Update"-ing the options when visiting ThunderWave, or resetting them to their defaults via the button in the Settings-page, and after both, reloading.

Optional file not allowed: 8ZX5YaixUUg8s7YSMzJ85riJBBdOH1NdWXm4C7fI.gif.piecemap.msgpack```
I think, I'm gonna try'n fix some of the issues for the private chat on ThunderWave now..!

Turns out, I really forget like just one f*ckng character in a lot of major things I program...
Also in ThunderWave.........
So I just found the cause for why the contact list for private chats was emptying itself.................. _CAN YOU FIND THE CHARACTER?_
# Before
```
if (!data2.hasOwnProperty("private_messages"))
    data2.private_messages = []
if (!data.hasOwnProperty("private_messages_with"))
    data2.private_messages_with = []
```
# After
```
if (!data2.hasOwnProperty("private_messages"))
    data2.private_messages = []
if (!data2.hasOwnProperty("private_messages_with"))
    data2.private_messages_with = []
```

BTW.:
I also added an Search-box in the last-seen-tab

Anyways, next up is the automatic scrolling, missing in private chats.!

## [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
### Update
#### Updated private-chats feature
Ok.
I fixed a few bugs, added, and changed a few things for ThunderWave's private chat.

When you now open a conversation (either via the contacts list, or via the last-seen tab), then that user will be pushed to the front of the contacts list.

Also, the auto-scroll has been fixed (at least somewhat) in private chats, though it does do a full reload whenever you send (and, I'm not sure on this, receive) a message, which means it might take a bit until you are able to see the messages again.

I'm not sure if I can fix the long loading time in private chats, as _all_ messages in the conversation are loaded, not just a fixed number, and on each scroll-up, like in the lobby.

Also, the contacts list is now scrollable on the y-axis, so it doesn't take up that much space (I might need to think about another way on doing this or where to place the contacts list).

The last-seen list go a bit of an overhaul in style, it now looks a lot cleaner IMO.
And I also added a search-box at the top of it, in which you can search for usernames, public_keys, and auth_address's.
Currently trying my best, to update my dark version of Spectre.css to the latest one, for ThunderWave....
Made some changes, on how images/gifs are displayed in messages (e.g. the image is the only thing in the message, then the messages box gets "cropped" to it's size)

## [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
### Update
#### Added citation/ answer of messages
You can now click the timestamp of any message (which has been updated to the latest version, meaning, that the user who wrote that message, had to be online at least once after this update), to insert the code for citation into the message-input!
Then just add all the stuff, you want, around it (not into it), and hit send.
Swoooooooosh!!!!!!!! A REAL CITATION OF THE MESSAGE (which does get updated, if the real message gets changed (probably not live however))!!!!!!!!111!1!!!!!

Just to mention it, this feature isn't available in private chat (at least not yet).

For more information on this update, please see [the issue on GitHub](
https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/56#issuecomment-345516340).

## [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
### Update
#### Want a different theme for ThunderWave?
### Here you go!

3 new options have been added, to provide you the ability to theme the 3 main elements of ThunderWave's UI:
- body
- message-bubbles
- navbar

## [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
### Update
#### Added functionality to directly open a private chat

You can now append `?PC:[USER_CERT_ID]` to ThunderWave's URL, e.g.: `/thunderwave.bit/?PC:glightstar@kaffie.bit`!

Somewhat finished group chat for [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)!

Try this link: [/thunderwave.bit/?GC:Abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz](/thunderwave.bit/?GC:Abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz)

See [the GitHub-Issue](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/19) for further information.

Fixed a lot of bugs and other small stuff, so especially ThunderWave's group-chat should work better now!

But I broke the Upload-System, _again_, so bare with me xD

## [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
### Update
#### Added a simple bot

Now you can chat with a bot in the Lobby of ThunderWave!
Just use the following syntax to execute a command: `?!/[CMD]`. E.g.: `?!/help` will show all commands available!

For further information, please see [this GitHub-issue](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/91)

## [ThunderWave](/thunderwave.bit)
### Update
#### Added 4 commands for Lobby-Bot

4 new commands have been added, to use with the Bot in the Lobby.

Check out [this GitHub-issue](https://github.com/AnthyG/ThunderWave/issues/91) for more information on them, or use the `?!/help`-command in the Lobby-Chat!

Just heard in german news, that #netneutrality has been "loosened" in the US?

**Very sad**

(At least, there's still a tiny bit of hope because of the Congressional Review Act)

Started working on a Note-taking app for ZeroNet!
Check out [the GitHub-Repo's issues](https://github.com/AnthyG/Thundote/issues/) for more information.

Next up is setting up the database correctly, as the very very basic functionality (so no encryption-stuff yet) already works.

Ideas are welcome in [issue #1](https://github.com/AnthyG/Thundote/issues/1) :)

If you want access to the zite, please tell me in a comment here, or in thunderwave's [lobby](/thunderwave.bit/).
I will then send you a private message via ThunderWave (so open up a conversation [with me](/thunderwave.bit/?PC:glightstar@kaffie.bit)!

For a Zite to be responsive properly, you'll need to add the following property to the Zites `content.json`:
`"viewport": "width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, shrink-to-fit=no"`

(At least that's what I do x))

After we saved this file we also have to modify our site’s root content.json to ignore everything in this directory on signing and load the file containing the rules:
```
  ...
    "ignore": "data/.*",
    "includes": {
        "data/users/content.json": {
            "signers": [],
            "signers_required": 1
        }
    },
  ...
```

> Note: You can give moderation permissions to other users by adding addresses to “signers” list.

(From [this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post:99:ZeroChat+tutorial) article)

So I'm really not sure, which means this is more like a question to @Nofish ..

Ok, so I was thinking about this a little bit, and I might have come up with a solution:

First of all, you have to decide: Should every single old post be optional, which would require to download every each of them with a separate click (not really, but this way would allow more control, though it would also use up more space in the users ```content.json```-File), or should all old posts be optional together, meaning they all get stored in a single file (maybe actually, there could be some way of organizing them into different files for different topics or so?), which would only take 3 new lines in the users ```content.json```-File, instead of probably hundreds. The bad thing with this is, that _all_ old posts get loaded..

And now to the mechanics..:
The user marks a post as "Old", the post get's cut out of the ```data.json```-File, and get's written into the ```old-data.json```-File, or into the posts specific ```post[XYZ]-data.json```-File.
This process would require a way to read out of the ```data.json```-File (so ```fileGet``` or ```fileQuery```), and write into the "new" ```old-data.json```-File (so ```fileGet```, and then ```fileWrite```).

Yeah.... I dunno xD

@Binchan: As far as I understand, what I did with ThunderWave's private chat system, it also hides the meta-data.

(But just for sake of letting anyone know, I'm not a cyber-security expert or similar)

@Binchan: No, I mean, because I encrypt not only the message, but also to who it is sent, and when it was sent.
I don't know, if ZeroNet does something like that, as it would probably be quite resource-intensive.

And the thing about Bob sending an mail via ZeroMail is that it has to get to Alice.
_Every_ user downloads that mail, and Alice might not be the first to receive it, if she even is online!
But as far as I remember, the way ZeroMail encrypts a mail, is that it doesn't encrypt the time the mail was sent.

I will be fixing this problem ASAP: For further information on the progress of this,

I found _something_..
`"SELECT 'follow' AS type, follow.date_added AS date_added, json.user_name || ' started following you' AS title, '' AS body, '?Profile/' || json.hub || REPLACE(json.directory, 'data/users', '') AS url FROM follow LEFT JOIN json USING(json_id) WHERE auth_address = '" + Page.user.auth_address + "' GROUP BY json.directory"`

The `GROUP BY`-thing right at the end
